translations.english_saheeh: By those [angels] lined up in rows
translations.english_hilali_khan: By those (angels) ranged in ranks (or rows).
translations.english_rwwad: By those [angels] lined up in rows,

translations.english_saheeh: And those who drive [the clouds]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By those (angels) who drive the clouds in a good way.
translations.english_rwwad: and those who drive [the clouds],

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1286]- To the prophets or among themselves.  Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) swears by these three kinds of angels to the fact mentioned in the following verse.

translations.english_saheeh: And those who recite the message,[1286]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By those (angels) who bring the Book and the Qur’ân from Allâh to mankind [Tafsir Ibn Kathîr].
translations.english_rwwad: and those who recite Allah’s words,

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, your God is One,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily your Ilâh (God) is indeed One (i.e. Allâh):
translations.english_rwwad: indeed, your God is One,

arabic_text: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ
phonetic: 37.5 Rabbu As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Baynahumā Wa Rabbu Al-Mashāriqi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1287]- i.e., each point or place of sunrise.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.37:5) The sun has approx. 365 points for its rising and 365 points for its setting (i.e. the number of days of a solar year). Every day it rises and sets in a new point, till the end of the year, then it comes back to the same point after a year. [See Tafsir Al-Qurtubi,].

translations.english_saheeh: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.[1287]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between them, and Lord of every point of the sun’s risings.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, and Lord of the points of sunrise.

arabic_text: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلۡكَوَاكِبِ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily We have adorned the near heaven with the stars (for beauty).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: We have adorned the sky with the beauty of the stars,

phonetic: 37.7 Wa Ĥifžāan Min Kulli Shayţānin Māridin

translations.english_saheeh: And as protection against every rebellious devil
translations.english_hilali_khan: And to guard against every rebellious devil.
translations.english_rwwad: and for safeguarding it against every rebellious devil,

arabic_text: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ وَيُقۡذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٖ
phonetic: 37.8 Lā Yassamma`ūna 'Ilá Al-Mala'i Al-'A`lá Wa Yuqdhafūna Min Kulli Jānibin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1288]- By flaming meteors.

translations.english_saheeh: [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,[1288]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They cannot listen to the higher group (angels) for they are pelted from every side.
translations.english_rwwad: so that they cannot eavesdrop on the highest assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side

translations.english_saheeh: Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Outcast, and theirs is a constant (or painful) torment.
translations.english_rwwad: to repel them; and for them there will be a perpetual punishment,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ خَطِفَ ٱلۡخَطۡفَةَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ ثَاقِبٞ
phonetic: 37.10 'Illā Man Khaţifa Al-Khaţfata Fa'atba`ahu Shihābun Thāqibāun

translations.english_saheeh: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except such as snatch away something by stealing, and they are pursued by a flaming fire of piercing brightness.
translations.english_rwwad: except who stealthily snatches away some words, he will be pursued by a piercing flame.

arabic_text: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَهُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَم مَّنۡ خَلَقۡنَآۚ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّن طِينٖ لَّازِبِۭ
phonetic: 37.11 Fāstaftihim 'Ahum 'Ashaddu Khalqāan 'Am Man Khalaqnā 'Innā Khalaqnāhum Min Ţīnin Lāzibin

translations.english_saheeh: Then inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created them [i.e., men] from sticky clay.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then ask them (i.e. these polytheists, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "Are they stronger as creation, or those (others like the heavens and the earth and the mountains) whom We have created?" Verily, We created them of a sticky clay.
translations.english_rwwad: So ask them, “Are they more difficult to create or other things We created? We created them from sticky clay.

translations.english_saheeh: But you wonder, while they mock,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) wondered (at their insolence) while they mock (at you and at the Qur’ân).
translations.english_rwwad: Rather you are astonished, while they ridicule it,

translations.english_saheeh: And when they are reminded, they remember not.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when they are reminded, they pay no attention.
translations.english_rwwad: and when they are reminded, they pay no heed,

translations.english_saheeh: And when they see a sign, they ridicule.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when they see an Ayâh (a sign, or an evidence) from Allâh, they mock at it.
translations.english_rwwad: and when they see a sign, they ridicule it,

arabic_text: وَقَالُوٓاْ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٌ

translations.english_saheeh: And say, "This is not but obvious magic.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they say: "This is nothing but evident magic!
translations.english_rwwad: and they say, “This is nothing but clear magic.

arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
phonetic: 37.16 'A'idhā Mitnā Wa Kunnā Turābāan Wa `Ižāmāan 'A'innā Lamab`ūthūna

translations.english_saheeh: When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
translations.english_hilali_khan: "When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we (then) verily be resurrected?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it that when we are dead and become dust and bones, will we really be raised up again,

translations.english_saheeh: And our forefathers [as well]?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And also our fathers of old?"
translations.english_rwwad: and our forefathers too?”

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "Yes, and you shall then be humiliated."
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “Yes, and you will be disgraced.”

arabic_text: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَإِذَا هُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
phonetic: 37.19 Fa'innamā Hiya Zajratun Wāĥidatun Fa'idhā Hum Yanžurūna

translations.english_saheeh: It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It will be a single Zajrah [shout (i.e. the second blowing of the Trumpet)], and behold, they will be staring!
translations.english_rwwad: It will only be a single Blast, and at once they will be looking around.

phonetic: 37.20 Wa Qālū Yā Waylanā Hādhā Yawmu Ad-Dīni

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "Woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense!"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!”

arabic_text: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
phonetic: 37.21 Hādhā Yawmu Al-Faşli Al-Ladhī Kuntum Bihi Tukadhibūna

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said): "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be told], “This is the Day of Decision that you used to deny.”

arabic_text: ۞ ٱحۡشُرُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ وَأَزۡوَٰجَهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ
phonetic: 37.22 Aĥshurū Al-Ladhīna Žalamū Wa 'Azwājahum Wa Mā Kānū Ya`budūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1289]- Those similar to them in evil deeds.  Another possible meaning is "their wives."

translations.english_saheeh: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds,[1289] and what they used to worship
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said to the angels): "Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions (from the devils) and what they used to worship,
translations.english_rwwad: [The angels will be told], “Gather all those who did wrong and their fellows, and whatever they used to worship

arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهۡدُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
phonetic: 37.23 Min Dūni Allāhi Fāhdūhum 'Ilá Şirāţi Al-Jaĥīmi

translations.english_saheeh: Other than Allāh, and guide them to the path of Hellfire
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Instead of Allâh, and lead them on to the way of flaming Fire (Hell);
translations.english_rwwad: besides Allah, and lead them to the way of Hell,

translations.english_saheeh: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "But stop them, verily they are to be questioned.
translations.english_rwwad: and stop them, for they are to be questioned.”

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "What is the matter with you? Why do you not help one another (as you used to do in the world)?"
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be asked], “What is the matter with you, that you no longer help one another?”

translations.english_saheeh: But they, that Day, are in surrender.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, but that Day they shall surrender.
translations.english_rwwad: Rather on that Day they will surrender completely.

translations.english_saheeh: And they will approach one another asking [i.e., blaming] each other.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they will turn to one another and question one another.
translations.english_rwwad: They will turn to one another, reproaching one another.

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَأۡتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1290]- i.e., from our position of strength, oppressing us.  Or from where we would have grasped the truth, preventing us.

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."[1290]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right side [i.e. from the right side of one of us and beautify for us every evil, enjoin on us polytheism, and stop us from the truth i.e. Islâmic Monotheism and from every good deed]."
translations.english_rwwad: [The followers] will say, “It was you who used to delude us from the right way.”

translations.english_saheeh: They [i.e., the oppressors] will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will reply: "Nay, you yourselves were not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: [The misleaders] will say, “Rather, you yourselves were not believers,

arabic_text: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيۡكُم مِّن سُلۡطَٰنِۭۖ بَلۡ كُنتُمۡ قَوۡمٗا طَٰغِينَ
phonetic: 37.30 Wa Mā Kāna Lanā `Alaykum Min Sulţānin Bal Kuntum Qawmāan Ţāghīna

translations.english_saheeh: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And we had no authority over you. Nay! But you were Tâghûn (transgressing) people (polytheists, and disbelievers).
translations.english_rwwad: and We had no power over you, rather you yourselves were a transgressing people.

arabic_text: فَحَقَّ عَلَيۡنَا قَوۡلُ رَبِّنَآۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: So the word [i.e., decree] of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So now the Word of our Lord has been justified against us, that we shall certainly (have to) taste (the torment).
translations.english_rwwad: Now the punishment of our Lord has come true against us; we will surely taste it.

translations.english_saheeh: And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So we led you astray because we were ourselves astray."
translations.english_rwwad: We did misguide you, for we ourselves were misguided”.

translations.english_saheeh: So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then verily, that Day, they will (all) share in the torment.
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day they will all share in the punishment.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Certainly, that is how We deal with Al-Mujrimûn (polytheists, sinners, disbelievers, criminals, the disobedient to Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We deal with the wicked,

arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوٓاْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ
phonetic: 37.35 'Innahum Kānū 'Idhā Qīla Lahum Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā Allāhu Yastakbirūna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allāh," were arrogant
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly, when it was said to them: Lâ ilâha illallâh "(none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh)," they puffed themselves up with pride[1] (i.e. denied it).
translations.english_rwwad: for whenever it was said to them, “None has the right to be worshiped except Allah,” they became arrogant,

arabic_text: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٖ مَّجۡنُونِۭ

translations.english_saheeh: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (they) said: "Are we going to abandon our âlihah (gods) for the sake of a mad poet?"
translations.english_rwwad: and said, “Are we going to abandon our gods for a mad poet?”

phonetic: 37.37 Bal Jā'a Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Şaddaqa Al-Mursalīna

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, he [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has come with the truth (i.e. Allâh’s religion - Islâmic Monotheism and this Qur’ân) and he confirms the Messengers (before him who brought Allâh’s religion - Islâmic Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: Rather, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, you (pagans of Makkah) are going to taste the painful torment;
translations.english_rwwad: You will surely taste the painful punishment,

arabic_text: وَمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 37.39 Wa Mā Tujzawna 'Illā Mā Kuntum Ta`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you will be requited nothing except for what you used to do (evil deeds, sins, and Allâh’s disobedience which you used to do in this world)
translations.english_rwwad: and you will only be recompensed for what you used to do,

translations.english_saheeh: But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Save the chosen slaves of Allâh (i.e. the true believers of Islâmic Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: except the chosen slaves of Allah.

translations.english_saheeh: Those will have a provision determined -
translations.english_hilali_khan: For them there will be a known provision (in Paradise),
translations.english_rwwad: They will have a known provision,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1291]- Meaning everything delicious.

translations.english_saheeh: Fruits;[1291] and they will be honored
translations.english_hilali_khan: Fruits; and they shall be honoured,
translations.english_rwwad: fruits; and they will be honored

translations.english_saheeh: In gardens of pleasure
translations.english_hilali_khan: In the Gardens of delight (Paradise),
translations.english_rwwad: in Gardens of Bliss,

translations.english_saheeh: On thrones facing one another.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Facing one another on thrones.
translations.english_rwwad: facing one another on couches.

translations.english_saheeh: There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Round them will be passed a cup of pure wine -
translations.english_rwwad: They will be served with a cup of wine from a flowing stream,

translations.english_saheeh: White and delicious to the drinkers;
translations.english_hilali_khan: White, delicious to the drinkers.
translations.english_rwwad: white and delicious for those who drink.

arabic_text: لَا فِيهَا غَوۡلٞ وَلَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا يُنزَفُونَ
phonetic: 37.47 Lā Fīhā Ghawlun Wa Lā Hum `Anhā Yunzafūna

translations.english_saheeh: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Neither will they have Ghoul (any kind of hurt, abdominal pain, headache, a sin) from that, nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.
translations.english_rwwad: It will cause no harm, nor will they be intoxicated by it,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1292]- i.e., chaste and modest, looking only at their mates.

translations.english_saheeh: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances,[1292] with large, [beautiful] eyes,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And beside them will be Qâsirât-at-Tarf [chaste females (wives), restraining their glances (desiring none except their husbands)], with wide and beautiful eyes.[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and with them will be maidens of modest gaze and beautiful eyes,

translations.english_saheeh: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Delicate and pure) as if they were (hidden) eggs (well) preserved.
translations.english_rwwad: as if they were well-protected eggs.

translations.english_saheeh: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they will turn to one another, mutually questioning.
translations.english_rwwad: Then they will turn to one another asking.

arabic_text: قَالَ قَآئِلٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٞ
phonetic: 37.51 Qāla Qā'ilun Minhum 'Innī Kāna Lī Qarīnun

translations.english_saheeh: A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth].
translations.english_hilali_khan: A speaker of them will say: "Verily, I had a companion (in the world),
translations.english_rwwad: One of them will say, “I had a close friend [in the world]

translations.english_saheeh: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who used to say: "Are you among those who believe (in resurrection after death).
translations.english_rwwad: who used to say, ‘Are you one of those who believe

arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
phonetic: 37.53 'A'idhā Mitnā Wa Kunnā Turābāan Wa `Ižāmāan 'A'innā Lamadīnūna

translations.english_saheeh: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "(That) when we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed (be raised up) to receive reward or punishment (according to our deeds)?"
translations.english_rwwad: that when we die and become dust and bones, shall we be brought for judgment?’”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1293]- To his companions in Paradise.

translations.english_saheeh: He will say,[1293] "Would you [care to] look?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: (The speaker) said: "Will you look down?"
translations.english_rwwad: He will say, “Do you wish to see [his fate]?”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1294]- The companion who had tried to dissuade him from belief on earth.

translations.english_saheeh: And he will look and see him[1294] in the midst of the Hellfire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So he looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.
translations.english_rwwad: So he will look down and see him in the midst of the Blazing Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: He will say, "By Allāh, you almost ruined me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "By Allâh! You have nearly ruined me.
translations.english_rwwad: He will say, “By Allah, you were about to ruin me.

arabic_text: وَلَوۡلَا نِعۡمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُحۡضَرِينَ
phonetic: 37.57 Wa Lawlā Ni`matu Rabbī Lakuntu Mina Al-Muĥđarīna

translations.english_saheeh: If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought forth (to Hell)."
translations.english_rwwad: Were it not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among those who are brought [to Hell].”

translations.english_saheeh: Then, are we not to die
translations.english_hilali_khan: (The dwellers of Paradise will say) "Are we then not to die (any more)?
translations.english_rwwad: [He will say to his fellow believers], “Are we not going to die anymore,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَوۡتَتَنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
phonetic: 37.59 'Illā Mawtatanā Al-'Ūlá Wa Mā Naĥnu Bimu`adhabīna

translations.english_saheeh: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except our first death, and we shall not be punished? (after we have entered Paradise)."
translations.english_rwwad: except our first death, nor are we going to be punished ?”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this is the great attainment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly, this is the supreme success!
translations.english_rwwad: This is indeed the supreme triumph!

translations.english_saheeh: For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.
translations.english_hilali_khan: For the like of this let the workers work.
translations.english_rwwad: For such [reward] let the workers work.

arabic_text: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيۡرٞ نُّزُلًا أَمۡ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ

translations.english_saheeh: Is that [i.e., Paradise] a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqūm?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is that (Paradise) better entertainment or the tree of Zaqqûm (a horrible tree in Hell)?
translations.english_rwwad: Is this a better accommodation or the tree of Zaqqūm?

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly We have made it (as) a trail for the Zâlimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, wrong-doers).
translations.english_rwwad: We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers.

arabic_text: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٞ تَخۡرُجُ فِيٓ أَصۡلِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-fire,
translations.english_rwwad: It is a tree that grows in the bottom of the Blazing Fire;

translations.english_saheeh: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of Shayâtîn (devils);
translations.english_rwwad: its fruits are like heads of devils.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَأٓكِلُونَ مِنۡهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ
phonetic: 37.66 Fa'innahum La'ākilūna Minhā Famāli'ūna Minhā Al-Buţūna

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly, they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.
translations.english_rwwad: They will certainly eat from it, filling their bellies.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا لَشَوۡبٗا مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then on the top of that they will be given boiling water to drink so that it becomes a mixture (of boiling water and Zaqqûm in their bellies).
translations.english_rwwad: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture of scalding water,

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then thereafter, verily, their return is to the flaming fire of Hell.
translations.english_rwwad: then their final return will be to the Blazing Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed they found their fathers astray.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, they found their fathers on the wrong path;
translations.english_rwwad: For they found their forefathers astray,

translations.english_saheeh: So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they (too) hastened in their footsteps!
translations.english_rwwad: so they rushed to follow in their footsteps.

translations.english_saheeh: And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed most of the men of old went astray before them;
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, most of the earlier people went astray before them,

translations.english_saheeh: And We had already sent among them warners.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We sent among them warners (Messengers);
translations.english_rwwad: even though We sent among them warners.

translations.english_saheeh: Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then see what was the end of those who were warned (but heeded not).
translations.english_rwwad: Then see how was the end of those who were warned,

translations.english_saheeh: But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except the chosen slaves of Allâh (faithful, obedient, and true believers of Islâmic Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: except the chosen slaves of Allah.

phonetic: 37.75 Wa Laqad Nādānā Nūĥun Falani`ma Al-Mujībūna

translations.english_saheeh: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed Nûh (Noah) invoked Us, and We are the Best of those who answer (the request).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Noah called upon Us; how excellent are We at responding!

phonetic: 37.76 Wa Najjaynāhu Wa 'Ahlahu Mina Al-Karbi Al-`Ažīmi

translations.english_saheeh: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We rescued him and his family from the great distress (i.e. drowning),
translations.english_rwwad: And We saved him and his household from the great distress,

translations.english_saheeh: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And, his progeny, them We made the survivors (i.e. Shem, Ham and Japheth).
translations.english_rwwad: and made his offspring the only survivors,

translations.english_saheeh: And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.english_hilali_khan: And left for him (a goodly remembrance) among the later generations:
translations.english_rwwad: and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:

translations.english_saheeh: "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Salâm (peace) be upon Nûh (Noah) (from Us) among the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists)!"
translations.english_rwwad: “Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, thus We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers - See V.2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We reward those who do good.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he [Nûh (Noah)] was one of Our believing slaves.
translations.english_rwwad: He was one of Our believing slaves.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We drowned the others [i.e., disbelievers].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We drowned the others (disbelievers and polytheists).
translations.english_rwwad: Then we drowned the others.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And, verily, among those who followed his [Nûh’s (Noah)] way (Islâmic Monotheism) was Ibrâhîm (Abraham).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Abraham was one of those who followed his way.

translations.english_saheeh: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart
translations.english_hilali_khan: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart [attached to Allâh Alone and none else, worshipping none but Allâh Alone - true Islâmic Monotheism, pure from the filth of polytheism].
translations.english_rwwad: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart,

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
phonetic: 37.85 'Idh Qāla Li'abīhi Wa Qawmihi Mādhā Ta`budūna

translations.english_saheeh: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When he said to his father and to his people: "What is it that which you worship?
translations.english_rwwad: and said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?

translations.english_saheeh: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allāh you desire?
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Is it a falsehood - âlihah (gods) other than Allâh - that you desire?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it false gods that you seek other than Allah?

translations.english_saheeh: Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then what think you about the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn, and all that exists)?"
translations.english_rwwad: Then what do you think of the Lord of the worlds?”

translations.english_saheeh: And he cast a look at the stars.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he cast a glance at the stars,
translations.english_rwwad: He then cast a glance at the stars,

translations.english_saheeh: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he said: "Verily, I am sick[1] (with plague). [He did this trick to remain in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan feast)]."
translations.english_rwwad: and said, “I am sick.”

translations.english_saheeh: So they turned away from him, departing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they turned away from him, and departed (for fear of the disease).
translations.english_rwwad: So they went away from him and left.

arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمۡ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1295]- Consume the offerings placed before them.

translations.english_saheeh: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?[1295]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he turned to their âlihah (gods) and said: "Will you not eat (of the offering before you)?
translations.english_rwwad: Then he turned to their gods and said, “Will you not eat?

translations.english_saheeh: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?".
translations.english_hilali_khan: "What is the matter with you that you speak not?"
translations.english_rwwad: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?”

translations.english_saheeh: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he turned upon them, striking (them) with (his) right hand.
translations.english_rwwad: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand.

translations.english_saheeh: Then they [i.e., the people] came toward him, hastening.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they (the worshippers of idols) came, towards him, hastening.
translations.english_rwwad: Then his people came rushing towards him.

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Worship you that which you (yourselves) carve?
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Do you worship what you yourselves carve,

phonetic: 37.96 Wa Allāhu Khalaqakum Wa Mā Ta`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: While Allāh created you and that which you do?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "While Allâh has created you and what you make!"
translations.english_rwwad: when it is Allah Who created you and all what you do?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ ٱبۡنُواْ لَهُۥ بُنۡيَٰنٗا فَأَلۡقُوهُ فِي ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
phonetic: 37.97 Qālū Abnū Lahu Bunyānāan Fa'alqūhu Fī Al-Jaĥīmi

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Construct for him a structure [i.e., furnace] and throw him into the burning fire."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Build for him a building (it is said that the building was like a furnace) and throw him into the blazing fire!"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Build a pyre for him and throw him into the blazing fire.”

translations.english_saheeh: And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the most debased.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they plotted a plot against him, but We made them the lowest.
translations.english_rwwad: They contrived a plan against him, but We made them the lowest.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

translations.english_saheeh: And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he said (after his rescue from the fire): "Verily, I am going to my Lord. He will guide me!"
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.

translations.english_saheeh: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "My Lord! Grant me (offspring) from the righteous."
translations.english_rwwad: My Lord, grant me righteous offspring.”

translations.english_saheeh: So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We gave him the glad tidings of a forbearing boy.
translations.english_rwwad: So We gave him glad tidings of a forbearing boy.

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡيَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَيَّ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ فِي ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّيٓ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
phonetic: 37.102 Falammā Balagha Ma`ahu As-Sa`ya Qāla Yā Bunayya 'Innī 'Ará Fī Al-Manāmi 'Annī 'Adhbaĥuka Fānžur Mādhā Tará Qāla Yā 'Abati Af`al Mā Tu'umaru Satajidunī 'In Shā'a Allāhu Mina Aş-Şābirīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1296]- i.e., the ability to work and be of assistance.

translations.english_saheeh: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion,[1296] he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allāh wills, of the steadfast."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And, when he (his son) was old enough to walk with him, he said: "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I am slaughtering you (offering you in sacrifice to Allâh). So look what you think!" He said: "O my father! Do that which you are commanded, Inshâ’ Allâh (if Allâh wills), you shall find me of As-Sâbirûn (the patient)."
translations.english_rwwad: Then when he reached the age where he could work with him, Abraham said, “O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice you. What you think?” He said, “O my dear father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, one of the steadfast.”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1297]- To the command of Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: And when they had both submitted[1297] and he put him down upon his forehead,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, when they had both submitted themselves (to the Will of Allâh), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (or on the side of his forehead for slaughtering);
translations.english_rwwad: When they both submitted [to Allah’s command] and Abraham laid him on his forehead,

translations.english_saheeh: We called to him, "O Abraham,
translations.english_hilali_khan: We called out to him: "O Abraham!
translations.english_rwwad: and We called out to him, “O Abraham,

arabic_text: قَدۡ صَدَّقۡتَ ٱلرُّءۡيَآۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ
phonetic: 37.105 Qad Şaddaqta Ar-Ru'uyā 'Innā Kadhālika Najzī Al-Muĥsinīna

translations.english_saheeh: You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: You have fulfilled the dream!" Verily thus do We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers - See 2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: You have fulfilled the dream.” This is how We reward those who do good.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this was the clear trial.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, that indeed was a manifest trial.
translations.english_rwwad: This was indeed a revealing test.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1298]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) sent a huge ram to be sacrificed in place of Ishmael.

translations.english_saheeh: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,[1298]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (i.e. كبش - a ram);
translations.english_rwwad: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

translations.english_saheeh: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We left for him (a goodly remembrance) among the later generations.
translations.english_rwwad: and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:

translations.english_saheeh: "Peace upon Abraham."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Salâm (peace) be upon Ibrâhîm (Abraham)!"
translations.english_rwwad: “Peace be upon Abraham.”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thus indeed do We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers - See V.2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We reward those who do good.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he was one of Our believing slaves.
translations.english_rwwad: He was one of Our believing slaves.

phonetic: 37.112 Wa Basharnāhu Bi'isĥāqa Nabīyāan Mina Aş-Şāliĥīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1299]- This verifies that the firstborn son who was to be sacrificed was Ishmael and not Isaac, as claimed by the Jews and Christians.

translations.english_saheeh: And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.[1299]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishâq (Isaac) - a Prophet from the righteous.
translations.english_rwwad: And We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac, a prophet, and one of the righteous.

arabic_text: وَبَٰرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسۡحَٰقَۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحۡسِنٞ وَظَالِمٞ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ مُبِينٞ
phonetic: 37.113 Wa Bāraknā `Alayhi Wa `Alá 'Isĥāqa Wa Min Dhurrīyatihimā Muĥsinun Wa Žālimun Linafsihi Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself [i.e., sinner].
translations.english_hilali_khan: We blessed him and Ishâq (Isaac). And of their progeny are (some) that do right, and some that plainly wrong themselves.
translations.english_rwwad: We blessed him and Isaac, but among their offspring were some who did good and some who clearly wronged themselves.

phonetic: 37.114 Wa Laqad Manannā `Alá Mūsá Wa Hārūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And, indeed We gave Our Grace to Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We bestowed Our favor upon Moses and Aaron,

phonetic: 37.115 Wa Najjaynāhumā Wa Qawmahumā Mina Al-Karbi Al-`Ažīmi

translations.english_saheeh: And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We saved them and their people from the great distress,
translations.english_rwwad: and We saved them and their people from the great distress,

translations.english_saheeh: And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And helped them, so that they became the victors;
translations.english_rwwad: and We helped them, so they were the victorious,

translations.english_saheeh: And We gave them the explicit Scripture [i.e., the Torah],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We gave them the clear Scripture;
translations.english_rwwad: and We gave them both the clear Scripture,

translations.english_saheeh: And We guided them on the straight path.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And guided them to the Right Path.
translations.english_rwwad: and guided them to the straight path;

translations.english_saheeh: And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We left for them (a goodly remembrance) among the later generations.
translations.english_rwwad: and We left for them [a favorable mention] among later generations:

translations.english_saheeh: "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Salâm (peace) be upon Mûsa (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)!"
translations.english_rwwad: “Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, thus do We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers - See V.2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We reward those who do good.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, they were two of Our believing slaves.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, they were among Our believing slaves.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, Iliyâs (Elias) was one of the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Elijah was one of the messengers.

translations.english_saheeh: When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When he said to his people: "Will you not fear Allâh?
translations.english_rwwad: When he said to his people: “Do you not fear Allah?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1300]- The name of a great idol worshipped by the people and said to mean "lord."

translations.english_saheeh: Do you call upon Baʿl[1300] and leave the best of creators -
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Will you call upon Ba‘l (a well known idol of his nation whom they used to worship) and forsake the Best of creators,
translations.english_rwwad: Do you call upon Ba‘l and ignore the Best of the Creators,

translations.english_saheeh: Allāh, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Allâh, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"
translations.english_rwwad: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”

translations.english_saheeh: And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they denied him [Iliyâs (Elias)], so they will certainly be brought forth (to the punishment),
translations.english_rwwad: But they rejected him, so they will surely be brought [for punishment],

translations.english_saheeh: Except the chosen servants of Allāh.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except the chosen slaves of Allâh.
translations.english_rwwad: except the chosen salves of Allah.

translations.english_saheeh: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We left for him (a goodly remembrance) among the later generations.
translations.english_rwwad: And We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1301]- Ilyāseen is said by some commentators to be a plural form, meaning "Elias and those who followed him."

translations.english_saheeh: "Peace upon Elias."[1301]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Salâm (peace) be upon Ilyâsîn (Elias)!"
translations.english_rwwad: “Peace be upon Elias.”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, thus do We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers, who perform good deeds totally for Allâh’s sake only - See V.2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We reward those who do good.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he was one of Our believing slaves.
translations.english_rwwad: He was one of Our believing slaves.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, Lût (Lot) was one of the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Lot was one of the messengers.

translations.english_saheeh: [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
translations.english_hilali_khan: When We saved him and his family, all,
translations.english_rwwad: When We saved him and all of his household,

translations.english_saheeh: Except an old woman [i.e., his wife] among those who remained [with the evildoers].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except an old woman (his wife) who was among those who remained behind.
translations.english_rwwad: except an old woman who was among those who stayed behind.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We destroyed the others.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We destroyed the rest (the town of Sodom at the place of the Dead Sea now in Palestine).
translations.english_rwwad: Then We destroyed the rest.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, you pass by them in the morning
translations.english_rwwad: You [Makkans] pass by their ruins by day

translations.english_saheeh: And at night. Then will you not use reason?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And at night; will you not then reflect?
translations.english_rwwad: and by night. Do you still not understand?

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And, verily, Yûnus (Jonah) was one of the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Jonah was one of the messengers.

translations.english_saheeh: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
translations.english_hilali_khan: When he ran to the laden ship:
translations.english_rwwad: When he fled to the fully-laden ship,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1302]- To determine who would be cast overboard in order to save the other passengers.  Having been overloaded, the ship was on the verge of sinking.

translations.english_saheeh: And he drew lots[1302] and was among the losers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he (agreed to) cast lots, and he was among the losers.
translations.english_rwwad: then he cast lots with them, but was among those who lost.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1303]- For having given up hope on his people prematurely and having left them without permission from Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.[1303]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then a (big) fish swallowed him as he had done an act worthy of blame.
translations.english_rwwad: The whale then swallowed him while he was blameworthy.

translations.english_saheeh: And had he not been of those who exalt Allāh,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Had he not been of them who glorify Allâh,
translations.english_rwwad: Were it not for the fact that he was one of those who glorify Allah,

arabic_text: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطۡنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1304]- Meaning that the belly of the fish would have become his grave.

translations.english_saheeh: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.[1304]
translations.english_hilali_khan: He would have indeed remained inside its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.
translations.english_rwwad: he would have stayed in its belly until the Day of Resurrection.

translations.english_saheeh: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But We cast him forth on the naked shore while he was sick,
translations.english_rwwad: But We cast him ashore on a barren land while he was ill,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1305]- Which is known to give cooling shade and to be a repellent of flies.

translations.english_saheeh: And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.[1305]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We caused a plant of gourd to grow over him.
translations.english_rwwad: and caused a gourd vine to grow over him.

arabic_text: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِاْئَةِ أَلۡفٍ أَوۡ يَزِيدُونَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1306]- i.e., returned him thereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: And We sent him[1306] to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (people) or even more.
translations.english_rwwad: We sent him to one hundred thousand people or more,

translations.english_saheeh: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while.
translations.english_rwwad: and they believed, so We let them enjoy for a while.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1307]- The people of Makkah claimed that the angels were daughters of Allāh, yet they preferred sons for themselves.

translations.english_saheeh: So inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?[1307]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Now ask them (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "Are there (only) daughters for your Lord and sons for them?"
translations.english_rwwad: So ask them, “Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?”

arabic_text: أَمۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَٰثٗا وَهُمۡ شَٰهِدُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or did We create the angels female while they were witnesses?
translations.english_rwwad: Or did We create the angels as females while they were watching?

translations.english_saheeh: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, it is of their falsehood that they (Quraish pagans) say:
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed, it is one of their fabrications when they say,

translations.english_saheeh: "Allāh has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Allâh has begotten [offspring - the angels being the daughters of Allâh)?" And, verily, they are liars!
translations.english_rwwad: “Allah has children,” and they are truly liars.

translations.english_saheeh: Has He chosen daughters over sons?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Has He (then) chosen daughters rather than sons?
translations.english_rwwad: Did He choose daughters over sons?

translations.english_saheeh: What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
translations.english_hilali_khan: What is the matter with you? How do you decide?
translations.english_rwwad: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

translations.english_saheeh: Then will you not be reminded?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Will you not then remember?
translations.english_rwwad: Will you not then take heed?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1308]- i.e., evidence.

translations.english_saheeh: Or do you have a clear authority?[1308]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or is there for you a plain authority?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you have any compelling proof?

translations.english_saheeh: Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then bring your Book if you are truthful!
translations.english_rwwad: Then bring your scripture, if you are truthful.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلُواْ بَيۡنَهُۥ وَبَيۡنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ نَسَبٗاۚ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمَتِ ٱلۡجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ
phonetic: 37.158 Wa Ja`alū Baynahu Wa Bayna Al-Jinnati Nasabāan Wa Laqad `Alimati Al-Jinnatu 'Innahum Lamuĥđarūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they have made [i.e., claimed] between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought [to punishment].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they have invented a kinship between Him and the jinn, but the jinn know well that they have indeed to appear (before Him) (i.e. they will be called to account).
translations.english_rwwad: They claim that there is kinship between Him and the jinn, when the jinn themselves know that such people will surely be brought [for punishment].

translations.english_saheeh: Exalted is Allāh above what they describe,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Glorified be Allâh! (He is free) from what they attribute unto Him!
translations.english_rwwad: Glorified is Allah far above what they ascribe [to Him].

translations.english_saheeh: Except the chosen servants of Allāh [who do not share in that sin].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except the slaves of Allâh, whom He chooses (for His Mercy i.e. true believers of Islâmic Monotheism who do not attribute false things unto Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: But not the chosen slaves of Allah.

translations.english_saheeh: So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So, verily you (pagans) and those whom you worship (idols)
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, you and whatever you worship

translations.english_saheeh: You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
translations.english_hilali_khan: Cannot lead astray [turn away from Him (Allâh) anyone of the believers],
translations.english_rwwad: none of you can lure anyone away from Him,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1309]- Due to his disbelief and evil deeds.

translations.english_saheeh: Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.[1309]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except those who are predestined to burn in Hell!
translations.english_rwwad: except those who are destined to burn in the Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
phonetic: 37.164 Wa Mā Minnā 'Illā Lahu Maqāmun Ma`lūmun

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1310]- Refuting what the disbelievers had said about them.
[1311]- For worship.  Or "an assigned task" to perform.

translations.english_saheeh: [The angels say],[1310] "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.[1311]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And there is not one of us (angels) but has his known place (or position);
translations.english_rwwad: [The angels say], “There is none among us but has a known station:

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, we (angels), we stand in rows (for the prayers as you Muslims stand in rows for your prayers);
translations.english_rwwad: We are indeed those who stand lined up in rows,

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, we are those who exalt Allāh."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, we (angels), indeed are those who glorify (Allâh’s Praises i.e. perform prayers).
translations.english_rwwad: and we are indeed those who glorify Allah.”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1312]- Before the revelation of the Qur’ān.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, they [i.e., the disbelievers] used to say,[1312]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed they (Arab pagans) used to say:
translations.english_rwwad: And [the pagans] used to say,

arabic_text: لَوۡ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكۡرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "If we had a reminder as had the men of old (before the coming of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم as a Messenger of Allâh),
translations.english_rwwad: “If only we had a scripture like the previous people,

translations.english_saheeh: We would have been the chosen servants of Allāh."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "We would have indeed been the chosen slaves of Allâh (true believers of Islâmic Monotheism)!"
translations.english_rwwad: we would have surely been true slaves of Allah.”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1313]- i.e., in their own message, the Qur’ān.

translations.english_saheeh: But they disbelieved in it,[1313] so they are going to know.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But (now that the Qur’ân has come) they disbelieve therein (i.e. in the Qur’ân and in Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم , and all that he brought, - the Divine Revelation), so they will come to know![1]
translations.english_rwwad: But they rejected it; soon they will come to know.

phonetic: 37.171 Wa Laqad Sabaqat Kalimatunā Li`ibādinā Al-Mursalīn

translations.english_saheeh: And Our word [i.e., decree] has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our slaves, the Messengers,
translations.english_rwwad: Our Word has already been given to Our slaves, the messengers,

translations.english_saheeh: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
translations.english_hilali_khan: That they verily would be made triumphant,
translations.english_rwwad: that it is surely they who will be given victory,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1314]- If not in this world, then definitely in the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers [i.e., the believers] will be those who overcome.[1314]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that Our hosts! they verily would be the victors.
translations.english_rwwad: and that Our soldiers will surely be the victors.

translations.english_saheeh: So, [O Muḥammad], leave them for a time.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So turn away (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from them for a while,
translations.english_rwwad: So turn away from them for a while.

translations.english_saheeh: And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And watch them and they shall see (the punishment)!
translations.english_rwwad: Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].

translations.english_saheeh: Then for Our punishment are they impatient?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do they seek to hasten on Our Torment?
translations.english_rwwad: Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?

arabic_text: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمۡ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
phonetic: 37.177 Fa'idhā Nazala Bisāĥatihim Fasā'a Şabāĥu Al-Mundharīna

translations.english_saheeh: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, when it descends in their courtyard (i.e. near to them), evil will be the morning for those who had been warned!
translations.english_rwwad: When it descends on their courtyard, how terrible will be the morning of those who were warned!

translations.english_saheeh: And leave them for a time.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So turn (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) away from them for a while,
translations.english_rwwad: And turn away from them for a while.

translations.english_saheeh: And see, for they are going to see.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And watch and they shall see (the torment)!
translations.english_rwwad: Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].

arabic_text: سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلۡعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Honour and Power! (He is free) from what they attribute unto Him!
translations.english_rwwad: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, far above what they ascribe [to Him],

translations.english_saheeh: And peace upon the messengers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And peace be on the Messengers!
translations.english_rwwad: and peace be upon the messengers,

translations.english_saheeh: And praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And all the praises and thanks be to Allâh, Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
